intro: Convolvulus sepium f. coloratus, commonly known as the redflower morning glory, is a variant of the common morning glory. It is a herbaceous perennial vine characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This ornamental plant is often used in gardens for its vibrant blooms and is relatively easy to cultivate.
